落.definition: to fall or drop; (of the sun) to set; (of a tide) to go out; to lower; to decline or sink; to lag or fall behind; to fall onto; to rest with; to get or receive; to write down; whereabouts; settlement

落下.definition: to fall; to drop; to land (of projectile)

落井下石.definition: to throw stones at sb who has fallen down a well (idiom); to hit a person when he's down

落伍.definition: to fall behind the ranks; to be outdated

落價.definition: (coll.) to fall or drop in price; to go down in price

落入法網.definition: to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested

落單.definition: to be on one's own; to be left alone; to be left out

落土.definition: (of seeds etc) to fall to the ground; (of the sun or moon) to set

落地.definition: to fall to the ground; to be set on the ground; to reach to the ground; to be born; (of a plane) to land

落地生根.definition: air plant (Bryophyllum pinnatum); to put down roots

落基山.definition: Rocky Mountains in West US and Canada

落塵.definition: dust fall; fallout (volcanic, nuclear etc); particulate matter

落子.definition: to place a stone on the board (in Go)

落實.definition: practical; workable; to implement; to carry out; to decide

落差.definition: drop in elevation; (fig.) gap (in wages, expectations etc); disparity

落幕.definition: the curtain drops; the end of the show

落座.definition: to sit down; to take a seat

落後.definition: to fall behind; to lag (in technology etc); backward; to retrogress

落得.definition: ending up as; leading to; resulting in; in total

落戶.definition: to settle; to set up home

落托.definition: down and out; in dire straits; unrestrained; unconventional

落拓.definition: down and out; in dire straits; unrestrained; unconventional

落敗.definition: to suffer a defeat; to fail; to fall behind

落枕.definition: to have a stiff neck after sleeping; (of the head) to touch the pillow

落棧.definition: to make a rest stop at a hotel; to put sth into storage

落榜.definition: to fail the imperial exams; to flunk

落款.definition: inscription with name, date, or short sentence, on a painting, gift, letter etc; to write such an inscription

落水.definition: to fall into water; to sink; overboard; fig. to degenerate; to sink (into depravity); to go to the dogs

落水狗上岸.definition: like a dog who fell in the river and climbs out—shaking all over

落汗.definition: to stop sweating; (mahjong and card games) to mark the tiles or cards with one's sweat, fragrance etc

落泊.definition: down and out; in dire straits; unrestrained; unconventional

落湯雞.definition: a person who looks drenched and bedraggled; like a drowned rat; deep distress

落潮.definition: (of a tide) to ebb or go out

落炕.definition: to be laid up in bed with illness

落空.definition: to fail; to fall through; to come to nothing

落筆.definition: to put pen to paper; to start to write or draw

落籍.definition: to settle in (a place); to take up permanent residence; (literary) to strike sb's name from a register

落網.definition: (of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net; (of a tennis ball) to hit the net; (of a criminal) to be captured

落腮鬍子.definition: variant of 絡腮鬍子|络腮胡子[luo4 sai1 hu2 zi5]

落腳.definition: to stay for a time; to stop over; to lodge; to sink down (into soft ground); leftovers

落色.definition: to fade; to discolor; also pr. [luo4 se4]

落花有意，流水無情.pinyin: luo4 hua1 you3 yi4 , liu2 shui3 wu2 qing2
落花有意，流水無情.definition: lit. the falling flowers are yearning for love, but the heartless brook ripples on (idiom); fig. one side is willing, yet the other one remains indifferent (usually of unrequited love)

落花流水.definition: to be in a sorry state; to be utterly defeated

落草.definition: to take to the woods to become an outlaw; (dialect) to be born (Etymology: in former times, a bed of straw or grass was used as padding during childbirth)

落草為寇.definition: (idiom) to take to the woods to become an outlaw

落荒而逃.definition: to flee in defeat; to bolt

落落大方.definition: (of one's conduct, speech etc) natural and unrestrained

落落寡交.definition: aloof and as a result friendless (idiom)

落落難合.definition: a loner; someone who does not easily get along with others

落葉.definition: dead leaves; to lose leaves (of plants); deciduous

落葉松.definition: larch tree (Pinus larix); deciduous pine tree

落葉歸根.definition: lit. a falling leaf returns to the roots (idiom); fig. all things go back to their source eventually; in old age, an expatriate returns home

落選.definition: to fail to be chosen (or elected); to lose an election

落難.definition: to meet with misfortune; to fall into dire straits

落馬.definition: (lit.) to fall from a horse; (fig.) to suffer a setback; to come a cropper; to be sacked (e.g. for corruption)

落馬洲.definition: Lok Ma Chau (place in Hong Kong)

落魄.definition: down and out; in dire straits; unrestrained; unconventional; also pr. [luo4 tuo4]
